terms.value: Department:Intergrated biomedical sciences,Division:Chemical biology,Institute of infectious diseases and Molecular medicine(IDM),Faculty of health science, University of Cape Town, South Africa

description: Here as an attempt to explore bacterial single-colony proteomics, we describe a quantitative mass spectrometry-based protocol to isolate and analyse the proteome of a single mycobacterial colony from 7H10 media. Tryptic peptides are evaluated with high performance liquid chromatography coupled with a hybrid quadrupole mass filter Orbitrap analyser (Q Exactive) and raw data analysed using the MaxQuant Suite and downstream analysis using Perseus software . A total of 7805 unique peptides and 1387 proteins were identified

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Single-colony, Proteomics, Mycobacteria, Mass spectrometry, protein extraction, bacterial proteome

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Iradukunda J, Ganief T, Blackburn JM, Soares NC. Mass Spectrometry-Based Analysis of Mycobacterial Single-Colony Proteome. Methods Mol Biol. 2021 2259:181-189

title: Mass spectrometry-based analysis of Mycobacterial single-colony proteome
